page.title: 10ST PETER'S CHURCH RUDDINGTON
page.content: We went to the church and {Mr. Adams} let us in and we went up the twisty stairs.At the top was a small door to the bell tower.In the dusty room were bars going across the enormous bells.We could ring the bells by tapping them. We then went down to the rope room. There are eight bells and a group of teenagers ring them for Sunday services and weddings.{Mr.Adams} is the captain of the belfry and he has been ringing for forty years. Some of the bells were first hung in the {Flawforth} Church in the 17th.century.The bells were recst in 1969 but the original inscriptions were retained. { "CELORUM ISTE PLACEAT TIBI { REX SONUS ISTE" { "May this sound pleasing to thee, { O King of Heaven" }
